meanings.definition: Happening or existing before others in time or order
meanings.sent1: The earliest bird gets the worm.
meanings.sent2: She always arrives at the earliest possible time.
meanings.sent3: The earliest memories of childhood are often the most vivid.
meanings.sent4: His earliest works laid the foundation for his later success.
meanings.sent5: The earliest light of dawn signaled the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the first stage of development
meanings.sent1: The earliest signs of spring are the blooming flowers.
meanings.sent2: The earliest version of the software had many bugs.
meanings.sent3: Her earliest attempts at painting were quite messy.
meanings.sent4: The earliest stages of a butterfly's life are fascinating.
meanings.sent5: The earliest steps in learning to read are crucial for future success.

meanings.definition: In the most primitive or original condition
meanings.sent1: The earliest form of communication was through gestures.
meanings.sent2: The earliest tools used by humans were simple stones.
meanings.sent3: Living in the forest, he embraced his earliest instincts.
meanings.sent4: The earliest civilizations relied on basic farming techniques.
meanings.sent5: In the earliest days of humanity, survival was the main focus.
